intro: Lophiaris tapiae, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the leaf axils. Its root system is extensive and adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Lophiaris tapiae is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
